ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Experiment start time (hh:mm)
Name of task.
The physiological measures taken during the subsequent experiment
What time did you go to bed last night?
What time did you wake up this morning?
Is that your usual amount of sleep?
Is the usual amount of sleep adequate for you?
Have you had any recent forced changes in your sleep pattern? (e.g., shift work)
Have you had any caffeine in the last 24 hours?
Smoker?
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes; 2= Yes, but not regularly (less than 10 per day); 3= Yes, regularly (10 or more a day); 4= Former smoker; 9=NK/missing

ElementDescription: Have you smoked any cigarettes in the last 2 hours? Quantity?
How long ago did you smoke cigarettes?
Have you consumed any alchohol in the past four hours? Quantity?
How long ago did you consume alcohol?
Have you used any recreational drugs in the past week?
Which recreational drugs and how often
Comments about Drug use frequency
When was the last time you used one of these drugs?
Have you ever had any serious head injuries?
What happened? Was treatment received? How long unconscious?
Vision:  Does (did) the subject have Vision/eye problems?
Details of the vision problem
Are you wearing contact lenses?
Are you currently seeing a physician for a medical problem?
Doctor said you had a medical problem
Notes: 0= No; 1 = Yes; -5= Item seen but not answered; -9= Item skipped by show-if logic; -999= Data not submitted (incomplete, item not seen)

ElementDescription: Was any medication taken within the last 24 hours? (Include over-the-counter medications)
Name of medication
Dosage/quantity of medication
In general, how are you feeling today?
Are you having any pain or anything that would affect your ability to participate?
Alcohol Breathalyzer Reading
Saliva swab drug test
How long ago did you consume nicotine?
Have you consumed alcohol in the last 24 hours?
If yes, how much alcohol in the last 24 hours?
Have you consumed any caffeine in the last 2 hours? (coffee, tea, Coke, Pepsi, Mountain Dew, Surge, other sodas)
How many hours did you sleep last night
Have you had any recent forced changes in your sleep pattern? (e.g., shift work, finals?)
How much caffeine have you consumed in the last 2 hours?
How long ago did you consume caffeine?
Have you used nicotine (such as cigarettes, electronic cigarettes/vape pen/e-hookah, hookah, chewing tobacco, or cigar) in the last 24 hours?
If used other tobacco/nicotine products in past 24 hours: What kind and how much?
How much nicotine have you consumed in the last 24 hours?
Are you...?
Notes: 0=Still ill today; 1=Been feeling better for the past day or two; 2=Have been better for at least 1 week?

ElementDescription: How many hours ago did you last eat?
Menstruation
ValueRange: Yes; No; Not applicable; Yes but date of consent unknown

ElementDescription: What has your general level of stress been over the past week (relative to usual levels)?
How alert do you feel today (relative to how you usually feel)?
Notes: 1=Super Alert; 2=More alert than usual; 3=Average alertness; 4=Drowsy; 5=Very out of it

ElementDescription: How many hours ago did you most recently have a cup?
On average, how many cups of coffee have you had per day in the past month?
How many hours ago did you most recently have a cigarette?
For how many years have you smoked?
Please describe the beer
Notes: the type of beer, size of beer, etc.

ElementDescription: Please describe the wine
Notes: type of wine, size of glasses, etc.

ElementDescription: Please describe the alcohol
Notes: type of alcohol, size of drink, etc.
